projects.title: PayFlow – Legacy Modernization
projects.description: Migration from legacy monolith to a modern, scalable web platform with microservices and CI/CD.
projects.challenge: 10-year-old monolith causing outages and slow release cycles.
projects.solution: React/Next.js frontend, Node microservices, PostgreSQL + Redis, GitHub Actions CI/CD on AWS.

testimonial.quote: Their modernization plan was surgical and effective. We ship faster and sleep better.

projects.title: MediGrid – Clinical Data Mesh Platform
projects.description: Enterprise-grade data mesh for clinical data across hospitals with governed access, real-time pipelines, and AI-driven quality checks.
projects.challenge: Six hospitals had siloed EHR systems, inconsistent data quality, and no governed way to share datasets with analytics teams.
projects.solution: Designed a domain-driven data mesh with event streaming (Kafka), lakehouse (Delta Lake), federated governance, automated PII detection, and ML-based anomaly checks; built clinician-facing portal for governed dataset requests.
projects.team: 9 engineers (2 Data Eng, 2 Platform, 2 BE, 1 FE, 1 ML, 1 QA)

testimonial.quote: We finally have governed, high-quality clinical data on tap. Our analytics and AI teams move twice as fast without risking compliance.
testimonial.author: Dr. Ayesha Rahman

projects.title: VoltGrid – EV Fleet Energy Orchestration
projects.description: Orchestrates charging for 5,000 EV fleet vehicles across depots and public chargers, optimizing cost and grid impact in real time.
projects.challenge: Charging windows collided with peak tariffs; vehicles often left depots under-charged; grid constraints triggered penalties.
projects.solution: Built demand-forecasting models, constraint-based scheduler, and real-time control plane over OCPP chargers; multi-tenant dashboards for fleet ops.
projects.team: 8 engineers (2 ML, 2 BE, 1 Platform, 1 FE, 1 DevOps, 1 QA)

testimonial.quote: Energy spend dropped immediately and vehicles are always ready. Operations finally trust the charging plan.
testimonial.author: Lena Vogt

projects.title: AeroOps – Airline Disruption Control Tower
projects.description: Real-time disruption management for airline ops: predicts delays, reassigns crews/aircraft, and automates passenger rebooking.
projects.challenge: Weather and crew disruptions caused cascading delays; manual replanning took hours; passenger experience suffered.
projects.solution: Built a decision support system with streaming data (ADS-B, weather, crew), ML delay predictions, constraint solver for crew/aircraft swaps, and self-serve rebooking portal.
projects.team: 10 engineers (2 Data Eng, 2 ML, 3 BE, 1 FE, 1 DevOps, 1 QA)
projects.compliance: SOC 2 controls, PII handling for passenger data

testimonial.quote: Our ops center can replan in minutes, not hours. We prevented cascading delays and passengers felt the difference.
testimonial.author: Mark Ellison

projects.title: NeuroFleet – Autonomous Warehouse Orchestrator
projects.description: Coordinates 1,200+ AMRs, conveyors, and pick stations with real-time optimization for throughput and safety in high-volume DCs.
projects.challenge: Robots and human pickers were colliding in priorities; idle time and congestion caused missed SLA cutoffs; no global optimizer.
projects.solution: Built a digital twin with live telemetry (LIDAR, PLC, WMS), reinforcement-learning policies for task allocation, and a constraint solver for aisle traffic; provided ops console with heatmaps and what-if simulation.
projects.team: 9 engineers (2 RL/ML, 3 BE, 1 Platform, 1 FE, 1 QA, 1 PM)
projects.compliance: ISO 27001-aligned controls, safety telemetry retention policies

phases.name: MVP Development
milestones: First robot task assigned by RL

implementation.methodology: Agile with 2-week sprints; safety-first deployment with staged rollouts
riskMitigation: Fallback to manual dispatch if RL fails

training.sessions: 8 hours ops manager training, 4 hours associate familiarization
training.certification: Ops managers certified on control tower usage

support.maintenance: Optional 12-month support package (L2/L3 on-call, monthly optimization reviews)
support.sla: P1: 2-hour response, P2: 8-hour response, P3: next business day
support.knowledgeTransfer: Full source code, architecture walkthroughs, 3 months embedded support

performance.benchmarks: Top 5% in industry for DC throughput efficiency (per Gartner 2024)

quotes: "No more guessing which robot to send where—system just works." – Ops Manager, Dallas DC
"We finally have visibility into bottlenecks in real time." – VP Operations

factors: Early buy-in from warehouse associates through pilot feedback loops
Staged rollout minimized disruption during peak season
Digital twin allowed safe testing before production changes
Close integration with existing WMS avoided workflow disruption

technical: RL convergence was faster with simulated pre-training before real-world data
gRPC outperformed REST for high-frequency robot telemetry
PostgreSQL needed careful indexing for spatial queries at scale
operational: Change management training was critical—ops teams were initially skeptical
Pilot facilities became internal champions for wider rollout
24/7 on-call for first month caught edge cases in production

planned: Expand to 8 additional facilities by Q3 2026
Add predictive maintenance for AMRs using anomaly detection
Integrate with yard management system for dock scheduling
futureRoadmap.scalability: Architecture supports 10,000+ robots per facility with horizontal scaling

testimonial.quote: We hit our peak season SLAs without adding headcount. The control tower shows exactly where to intervene, and robots stay out of each other's way.
testimonial.author: Priya Kapoor
